meanings.definition: The direction in which a vein of ore runs underground.
meanings.sent1: Miners followed the hading to find the precious ore deep in the mine.
meanings.sent2: The geologist explained how the hading of the vein indicated the best drilling approach.
meanings.sent3: The hading of the ore seemed to play hide and seek with the miners.
meanings.sent4: The hading of the vein led them to a treasure trove of minerals.
meanings.sent5: The hading of the ore was like a secret map to hidden riches.

meanings.definition: The angle between the magnetic meridian and the true meridian of a compass.
meanings.sent1: The sailors adjusted the ship's course based on the hading shown by the compass.
meanings.sent2: The explorer carefully noted the hading to ensure they stayed on the right path.
meanings.sent3: The hading of the compass needle made the captain chuckle at its quirkiness.
meanings.sent4: The hading of the compass needle pointed them in the right direction like a wise old guide.
meanings.sent5: The hading of the compass needle was a reliable indicator of true north.
